profile.headline: Stamp 2 | Web Developer | Python and Java Developer | Data Analyst | ML Engineer
profile.summary:
Currently pursuing a Master of Science in Big Data Management and Analytics at Griffith College Dublin, with an expected graduation in September 2026. Recently completed a Higher Diploma in Science in Computing at the same institution, building a strong academic foundation in computing and analytics.

Most recently contributed to operational efficiency as part of the aircraft appearance team at Sky Handling Partner. Previous roles include customer acquisition at Prou Education Recruitments, where collaboration and sales techniques were applied to achieve team goals. Core competencies span customer service, problem-solving, and technical skills in data mining, pandas, and Tableau. Passionate about leveraging analytics education and technical expertise to support data-driven decision-making.

experience.title: Aircraft appearance
highlights: Contributed to operational efficiency as part of the aircraft appearance team during aircraft turnaround operations.

experience.title: Customer acquisition and sales
highlights: Spearheaded customer acquisition efforts, leveraging a range of sales techniques to meet and exceed targets.
Demonstrated leadership and teamwork skills to effectively manage and contribute to a sales team.
Utilized problem-solving and client relations skills to provide excellent customer service and build lasting relationships.

experience.title: Project Intern
highlights: Designed a GSM-based fire detection system using C++, reducing emergency response time by 40%.
Collaborated with a 4-member team to integrate real-time SMS alerts, preventing potential property damages.

experience.title: Content writer
highlights: Wrote and edited articles on a variety of topics including science, space, and music.
Utilized project planning and creative writing skills to produce high-quality content.
Collaborated with a team to interview and showcase new and emerging artists.

experience.title: Web Developer Internship
highlights: Developed a functional e-commerce website from concept to deployment using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Implemented core front-end features, enabling users to select items and manage a shopping cart.
Created an interactive user interface using front-end web development fundamentals.
Used Git for version control and collaborated effectively within a team.

education.qualification: Masters of Science, Big Data Management and Analytics
Bachelor's in Engineering, Electronics and Computer Engineering

education.institution: Delhi Public School, Bokaro Steel City

highlights: Orchestrated and participated in community development projects including blood donation drives and environmental awareness campaigns; managed a team of 15 volunteers.
Led a successful tree plantation drive, resulting in the planting of 500+ saplings.

projects.title: Melbourne Housing Data Analysis using Jupyter
highlights: Analyzed and provided insights for the Melbourne Housing dataset.
Managed 35,000+ data points by imputing missing values and resolving outliers where necessary.
Identified focus areas for sales strategy based on exploratory analysis.

projects.title: Predicting medical conditions of patients using real time data
highlights: Built an end-to-end ML pipeline to predict 7 medical conditions using demographic, clinical, and lifestyle risk factors (CRISP-DM).

Preprocessed data (missing values, IQR outlier capping, encoding/scaling) and trained Multinomial Logistic Regression; benchmarked against tuned Random Forest (GridSearchCV + StratifiedKFold, macro-F1).
Added KMeans patient segmentation for profiling; achieved 0.912 test accuracy and 0.897 macro-F1.

projects.title: Breast Cancer prediction model using ML
highlights: Developed a breast cancer prediction model in Python using Support Vector Machine (SVM) from scikit-learn.
Performed data collection, cleaning, and standardization on a dataset with 500+ entries; implemented a train-test split for evaluation.
Built a predictive system to classify breast cancer as benign or malignant based on diagnostic data.

projects.title: Wordle game using Java
highlights: Built a console-based Wordle game in Java with input validation, scoring, and attempt tracking.
Implemented letter marking, regex validation, and menu-driven gameplay to enhance user experience.
Applied OOP principles for modular design and code reusability.
Integrated a website UI for scoring using JavaScript.

projects.title: Automated Fault detection system for Distillation Columns using ML
highlights: Developed an automated fault detection system for distillation columns using gamma scanning data and FFT for quantitative analysis.
Built a Python GUI to process real-world data from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (B.A.R.C.), reducing manual evaluation.
Implemented ratio-based comparison with an error margin to predict uneven liquid distribution; matched a completed case study.

projects.title: Hospital Management system using SQL
highlights: Engineered a hospital management system using Oracle SQL/PLSQL, focusing on normalization and relational schema modeling.
Automated patient registration, billing, and staff workflows using stored procedures, triggers, and role-based access control.
Optimized performance with indexes, sequences, and cursors for scalable and reliable transactions.

projects.title: Underwater Fish Recognition using Deep learning
highlights: Built a fish recognition model using pre-trained MobileNetV2 CNN; achieved 97.41% test accuracy on 9 fish species.
Used NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and Keras for preprocessing, training, and testing.
Improved image quality via scaling, cropping, and filtering to boost feature reliability.

projects.title: Password based door-lock system in 8051 using Proteus & Keil uVision5
highlights: Designed and simulated a password-based door-lock system using an 8051 microcontroller.
Developed C code in Keil uVision5 to handle password verification, keypad input, and control a door motor and LCD.
Validated functionality using Proteus simulation to grant/deny access based on a five-digit password.

projects.title: Fire detector using GSM
highlights: Built a temperature-sensor based fire detection concept using GSM and C language to detect temperature rise and send alerts to phones.

projects.title: Tic-Tac-Toe Game Simulation using Emu8086 Software
highlights: Developed a two-player Tic-Tac-Toe game using assembly language in the Emu8086 emulator.
Implemented game logic for player turns, win conditions (horizontal, vertical, diagonal), and tie games.
Used emulator features to simulate CPU, RAM, and display for a functional 3x3 grid game.

projects.title: IoT Applications in Smart Home using Cisco Packet Tracer
highlights: Built an IoT smart home setup in Cisco Packet Tracer integrating a home gateway, smartphone, and smart devices.
Implemented automation: carbon detection alarm, motion-detecting webcam trigger, humidity-controlled fan, and temperature-based siren.
Configured interconnected devices for autonomous operation to improve home security, comfort, and energy efficiency.

certifications.title: Power BI Essential Training
certifications.issuer: National Association of State Boards of Accountancy (NASBA)

certifications.title: Bits and Bytes of Computer Networking
